intro: Phellopterus macrocarpus, commonly known as the large-fruited phellopterus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces large, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature. It is native to parts of Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
